caption: This is one of the best museums I have ever visited. The audio tour with Charlotte’s narration is poignant,  haunting and remarkable.  A tour of the Gainsbourg home gives depth to Gainsbourg’s personal life. The adjacent museum provides a salute to his professional legacy. Amazing!

It was a beautiful, yet deeply moving and emotional moment. It reminded me that everything in life is only borrowed. We come into this world with nothing, and we leave it the same way. Some people leave behind lasting memories, while others are forgotten soon after their passing. A hundred years later, there might be no one left who remembers them.  A special thanks to Serge’s family for sharing such open and intimate insights into his life. It is truly admirable how they chose to honor the memory of such a remarkable person by sharing it with the public. This was an unforgettable experience that truly makes you reflect on life.

Absolutely loved the moment ✨ Narrated by Charlotte the visit of the house offers a real intimate moment feel! There’s no ‘mass’ visiting so you actually get to enjoy the silence of a house that was once filled with music and an incredible talent and personality. The museum bit leading to the Gainsbarre is also fab, full of memorabilia and great storytelling! You have to be patient to get to your tickets but it’s well worth the wait 💛 highly recommended!

An incredibly beautiful, emotionally overwhelming, immersive exhibition – no, happening – where Charlotte Gainsbourg herself guides you (audio-wise) through the original, meticulously restored 14 Rue de Verneuil and the life of Serge Gainsbourg. (No pictures allowed inside la Maison, rightfully so).

I highly recommend this. But make sure you buy tickets in advance!! It felt so personal to be guided by Charlotte Gainsbourg. It was an honour and a privilege to be able to set foot in Serge’s house. The museum is very cool as well. The Gainsbarre looks very fancy and the drinks are good.

Had a wonderful visit to the house and museum.   The experience of house is fantastic you really feel as though you are in the midst of Serge's time there.  So glad I finally succeeded in getting a ticket.  The museum is also great.  So much to see and learn.  Also had a lovely visit in the Gainesbarre before leaving, even got to experience the piano.  Superb!  Highly recommend!

For me it's best museum, which I was in. It's so unbelievable, that we have opportunity to be in house of Serge, and see through Charlotte's voice all they life. I love Jane so much, and it's always was interesting to see place, which she described in her dairy. Also it's unbelievable to see that place, where Serge made his songs. Very moving place. We also enjoyed moment in bar and second part of museum.  Everything was interesting. In shop a lot of books, but not on English.

My husband is a massive Serge Gainsbourg fan. Unfortunately we couldn't get tickets for the house tour (fully booked till January 2025!) so we visited the museum instead. It's not very big, in fact it's mostly a long corridor, but it is packed with artifacts. As you move down the space, on your right hand side there are a number of screens showing films detailing different decades of Serge's life. Then, on your left, are artifacts relating to what you've just watched. It's very well done, and it did take us a good hour to move through. Then you go down to a cellar area, where there are two immersive 'booths' where you can hear the music to 'Melody Nelson' in one and Serge's voice track from the song in another, along with another display of artifacts. Finally, you ascend some stairs and you come out into a small, but very swish, piano bar where you can purchase drinks and food. Then you exit through the gift shop. Highly recommend.
An absolutely brilliant tour and experience. The tour of the house was fascinating and so evocative, narrated by his daughter. Perfectly managed to avoid crowd congestion.

Being able to walk around Serge’s house was an incredibly moving experience, made even more so by Charlotte’s commentary. It was a real privilege to see. The museum is also excellent. An absolute must-see for all Gainsbourg fans. Merci!

I've loved Gainsbourg since 1991 when I was a student in France.  Yes, it's hard to get tickets for the house visit, and yes it was absolutely worth it.  If you want to go, it's essential to sign up for updates and you should create an account in advance, get on line the day tickets go on sale and be prepared to take whatever date you can get.  The museum alone is worth the trip and has been beautifully conceived and thought through, although most of the explanatory text is in French only. Oh...and resist the temptation to read spoilers about the visit.  All will be revealed.

Both the house and the museum are highly interesting, and not just for the die hard fans. The audio guided visit of the house makes it feel like Charlotte is in the house with you. There is a cap on numbers of visitors so it never feels crowded. The museum is the perfect size, you don't need 3 hours to visit it but it still contains a large number of artifacts and information. The staff is nice and welcoming.

Amazing and wonderfully crafted experience and guided tour through the life of Serge Gainsbourg. This is very unique and absolutely worth the wait. book early in advance to do a visit not only of the museum but also the house. Charlotte Gainsbourg made a special audio tour and soundtrack to let you trancent in time and space.

great to finally see the inside of this place, after visiting the façade every single time I’ve been in Paris. it was very moving to move around in the house where Serge Gainsbourg lived, together with Jane, Charlotte, Kate, Bambou, … his cigarette butts are still in the ashtray, there’s still a dent in the coach from where he used to sit. I hope this place mever changes, it’s magical for fans.
Cool museum with a lot of personal documents, items, videos , cozy bar and amazing shop

What a truly wonderful experience. An intimate visit into a rich life, soothed by Charlotte's soft spoken memories and voices from the past. A fascinating insight into Gainsbourg's life and completed by the museum which contains a wealth of information and mementoes.
What a wonderful experience! The tour was so engaging and charlotte’s voice is beautiful. The tour of the house is 30 minutes followed by a walk through the museum.

House-museum, gift shop and bar in the name of the famous artist. We could get only to the shop. Museum tickets are sold out till jan 2024. The bar was closing for a dinner break 18-19h (barmen have to eat). Being a big fan of this composer-writer-singer, I was expecting more life in the bar, and definitely not soft Sia songs on the mechanical piano. The all black design, gloomy barmen amd the fantom piano gave us more of a burial vibe. I was really hoping to find the Serge's spark in this place. Hope to visit the museum next time!

Extremely disappointed to discover on the spot that our tickets were only for the (so-called) “museum” (and not the artist house) While it was my mistake to book a ticket for the “museum” only instead of one including the visit of the house (even though I have to point out that the website is misleading), it’s quite outrageous to call this long corridor with few personal items of the artist and some videos a “museum”!

For eternal Gainsbourg's fans, this is a lovely tiny museum covering the music genius' music path and life. The immersive visit of the museum is short but very comprehensive,  with personal items of the artist, his voice, photos and videos.  The eccentric black and white bar at the end of the visit  with the electric piano  gives you the impression that Serge's spirit is omnipresent. I would highly recommend to schedule a combined  visit (museum and house)  in advance because of the high demand!
A very special and intimate experience. The display brings you to the past…highly recommend

Maison de Gainsbourg is a must visit. The voice of his daughter Charlotte is very touching. (Audio guide is given to you) I was crying the whole visit. I recommend to see some photos of Serge in his house before the visit to better understand the connection between him and the house.

The website is so poorly done, we booked 4 tickets to see the house as marked out on google only to arrive and find out they have different ticket categories which is not clearly marked on the website, the tickets were not for the house but for an entire different place “the museum”. They didn’t reimburse me, such a rip-off.
The bar is the cherry on the top 🔝 …
Top!
Super !
A must see in Paris.
Excellent moment
Highly recommend!
Amazeballs
Super
Wonderful. My wife and I are long time Serge and Charlotte fans and we loved the house tour and museum. The recorded narration from Charlotte was enchanting and emotional.

Very moving and immersive visit to the house of Serge Gainsbourg Guided by Charlotte who conveys a lot of emotions to us, We experienced this moment as if we were outside of present time, back several years ago. Very nice experience of sharing and memories. Once the house has been visited, head to the museum in which many memories take you back to the house. Well done Charlotte, for the work done, it's really Fabulous and we are delighted to finally have visited. It will remain one of the very beautiful memories of a sunny weekend in Paris.

A very moving experience! An intimate immersion in the house of Serge Gainsbourg in his daily life guided by the very soft and emotional voice of Charlotte, who takes us around the house of her childhood, room by room, telling us her memories in this place which she has remarkably kept intact. Everything is really very well organized, followed by the visit to the museum, also very well done, a must do absolutely 👍

Being able to visit the house of a singing icon with whom we grew up is already something extraordinary in itself, but with Charlotte's comments it is even more moving. She tells, describes, the use of each piece from Serge's time, mixing memories and emotion. We really feel a "soul" in this house with the impression that it is still inhabited and that they are still there. Very moving. I highly recommend!

An extraordinary visit that transcends the simple museum tour to become an intimate journey into the unique world of Serge Gainsbourg. The house at 5 bis rue de Verneuil is much more than a place of memory, it is an artistic sanctuary where every detail tells a story, where each object whispers the secrets of a legend. As soon as you cross the threshold, you are caught up in the magnetic atmosphere of this place. The walls, covered in graffiti and souvenirs, still speak of the rebellious and brilliant soul of Gainsbourg. It's as if the artist has just left the room, leaving behind the scent of his creative genius and all-consuming passion. Every corner of the house is a living poem: - Musical instruments still seem to vibrate with iconic melodies that have marked several generations - Personal works of art tell the story of a total artist, far beyond the simple label of singer - The preserved intimacy allows an almost mystical connection with the spirit of Gainsbourg It's not just a visit, it's a journey into the intimacy of a sacred monster of French culture. We emerge transformed, our hearts overflowing with emotion, our minds populated with the melodies and words of this brilliant artist. For lovers of music, art and French culture, this visit is simply essential. A moment of pure grace that will stay with you long after you have left the house. An experience that transcends time, a living tribute to one of the most complex and fascinating artists of the 20th century.

Just great, the feeling of going back to the past and sharing intimate moments of the Gainsbourg family. The visit is fascinating and Charlotte's comments are moving, we imagine with emotion how they lived in the apartment. I would be happy to return there as well as to the museum which is full of souvenirs, information, unknown videos about his life, unusual objects, the shop is nice you can find photos, postcards, etc. there. to make this moment unforgettable. in one. Word enjoy going to visit this magical place, because maybe one day….. it will no longer be possible to visit it 🥺

A lovely suspended moment with Charlotte’s sweet voice! Incredible experience: Being transported into Serge's life as soon as the door closes! Time stands still... and yet what Charlotte says, my sister and I really experienced! Exceptional surprise✨
